form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Thune(for himself andMr. Wyden) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to theCommittee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Tariff Act of 1930 to increase and adjust for inflation the maximum value of articles that may be imported duty-free by one person on one day, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Low Value Shipment Regulatory Modernization Act of 2013 .

section.header: Sense of Congress on de minimis informal entries

paragraph.text: Modernizing international customs is critical for United States businesses of all sizes, consumers in the United States, and the economic growth of the United States.

Higher thresholds for the value of articles that may be entered informally and free of duty provide significant economic benefits to businesses and consumers in the United States and the economy of the United States through costs savings and reductions in trade transaction costs.

subsection.text: It is the sense ofCongressthat theUnited States Trade Representativeshould encourage other countries, through bilateral, regional, and multilateral fora, to establish commercially meaningful de minimis values for express and postal shipments that are exempt from customs duties and taxes and from certain entry documentation requirements, as appropriate.

section.header: Increase in and adjustment for inflation of maximum value of articles that may be imported duty-free by one person on one day

subsection.text: Section 321 of the Tariff Act of 1930(19 U.S.C. 1321)is amended—

paragraph.text: insubsection (a)(2), by strikingsubparagraph (C)and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: in any other case, the dollar amount specified insubsection (c).

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Annual adjustment of value of articles that may enter duty-Free

paragraph.text: The dollar amount specified in this subsection is—

subparagraph.text: subject toparagraph (2), for any calendar year after calendar year 2014, an amount equal to $800 increased by an amount equal to—

clause.text: the percentage of the increase (if any) in the Consumer Price Index for the preceding calendar year compared to the Consumer Price Index for calendar year 2013.

paragraph.text: Any increase underparagraph (1)of the dollar amount specified in this subsection shall be rounded to the nearest increment of $50.

paragraph.header: Consumer Price Index for any calendar year
paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, the Consumer Price Index for any calendar year is the average of the Consumer Price Index as of the close of the 12-month period ending on September 30 of that calendar year.
For purposes of this subsection, the termConsumer Price Indexmeans the last Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers published by theBureau of Labor Statistics of the Department of Labor.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section apply to articles entered, or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption, on or after January 1, 2014.
